ABC Systems Holdings Ltd is a publicly listed company on the Singapore Exchange (SGX), specializing in providing cutting-edge IT solutions and services. Established under the laws of Singapore, the company is headquartered in Singapore and has expanded its operations across multiple international markets.

ABC offers a diverse portfolio of software solutions, including digital governance platforms, document management systems, and AI-driven business applications. The company primarily serves government agencies, financial institutions, and enterprises, helping them enhance operational efficiency and digital transformation. Key subsidiaries under ABC Systems Holdings Ltd further support its global presence, reinforcing its expertise in enterprise solutions.

With a strong foothold in Asia-Pacific, ABC operates in countries such as Singapore, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Indonesia, Thailand, Vietnam, the Philippines, and Australia. The company continues to expand its market reach, catering to both public and private sector clients.

As of its latest financial report, ABC Systems Holdings Ltd reported an annual revenue of [insert figure, if available] and maintains a robust financial position, supporting its long-term growth strategy.

For the most comprehensive and up-to-date corporate and financial information, stakeholders are encouraged to review the company’s latest Annual Report and regulatory filings with the Singapore Exchange (SGX). Direct inquiries to the investor relations department can also provide further insights into the company’s performance and strategic direction.

This report covers ABC Systems Pte. Ltd., ABC Systems (USA) Inc., and ABC Systems (Europe) GmbH. The reporting boundary follows an operational control approach, including entities where the company has significant influence over sustainability-related policies and impacts. Notably, ABC Systems (Europe) GmbH is included in sustainability reporting but not in the audited consolidated financial statements due to differences in financial consolidation rules and sustainability disclosure criteria. While financial reporting is governed by accounting regulations, sustainability reporting prioritizes operational impact over financial control.

To ensure data consistency, sustainability information is consolidated across all included entities, with adjustments for minority interests where relevant. Mergers, acquisitions, and disposals are accounted for by retrospectively adjusting data where feasible, maintaining comparability across reporting periods. These adjustments ensure that sustainability disclosures accurately reflect the organization's performance while aligning with GRI Standards.

ABC Systems Holdings Ltd.’s sustainability report follows the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) Standards and covers the period from January 1, 2019, to December 31, 2019, aligning with the company’s financial reporting timeline. The report is published annually, with the latest edition released on August 30, 2020—after the reporting period—to allow for data collection, validation, and review. This ensures the accuracy and reliability of disclosed sustainability information.

To ensure data accuracy and minimize the need for restatements, the organization follows a rigorous internal review process, which includes cross-departmental validation and quality checks before publication.

ABC Systems Holdings Ltd. is committed to enhancing the credibility and reliability of its sustainability reporting through external assurance. While no external assurance was obtained for the 2020 Sustainability Report, the Board of Directors and senior executives continue to evaluate the engagement of an independent assurance provider for future reports, including the financial year ending March 31, 2021. Potential assurance will follow recognized ESG standards for publicly listed companies in Singapore, such as the Singapore Exchange (SGX) Sustainability Reporting Guide and the ISCA Sustainability Reporting Framework, ensuring alignment with best practices. Sample:
For the fiscal year 2020, ABC Systems Holdings Ltd.'s energy consumption outside the organization totaled 1,314 gigajoules (GJ). This includes energy used for business travel, employee commuting, and outsourced data center operations, which contribute significantly to the organization’s external energy footprint. Energy consumption data was collected from utility bills, fuel receipts, and service provider reports, ensuring alignment with GRI 302: Energy 2016 for consistency and comparability. Standard conversion factors from the International Energy Agency (IEA) were applied to harmonize energy units across various sources and regions.

Compared to fiscal year 2019, when external energy consumption totaled 1,280 GJ, there was a 2.7% increase, primarily driven by higher reliance on outsourced IT infrastructure to support remote operations. Where direct consumption data was unavailable, estimates were made using historical consumption patterns and industry benchmarks, with clear documentation of assumptions used. Moving forward, the company aims to enhance data accuracy by working more closely with energy providers and implementing automated tracking systems.

Sample: For FY2020, ABC Systems Holdings Ltd.’s energy intensity ratio was 0.0010 GJ per USD of revenue, calculated by dividing total energy consumption (1,314 GJ) by total revenue in USD. This ratio includes electricity, heating, and cooling across operations in Hong Kong, the Philippines, and the United Kingdom. The slight improvement from 0.0011 GJ per USD in FY2019 was primarily driven by energy efficiency measures in office spaces and a shift toward remote work, reducing in-office energy use. Where regional revenue data was unavailable, estimates were made based on historical financial trends to ensure a consistent calculation. To further refine accuracy, ABC plans to track energy use by office location and implement a centralized energy management system for more precise monitoring and reduction of consumption.

Guidance:
a. Amount of reductions in energy consumption achieved as a direct result of conservation and efficiency initiatives, in joules or multiples.
b. Types of energy included in the reductions; whether fuel, electricity, heating, cooling, steam, or all.
c. Basis for calculating reductions in energy consumption, such as base year or baseline, including the rationale for choosing it.
d. Standards, methodologies, assumptions, and/or calculation tools used.
Sample: In fiscal year 2020, ABC Systems Holdings Ltd. achieved an absolute reduction in energy consumption of 126 GJ, representing a 8.75% decrease from FY2019. This reduction, measured against the baseline year of FY2018, includes electricity, heating, and cooling across all operational locations. The decline was driven by efficiency initiatives, such as replacing fluorescent lights with LED systems in the Philippines office, implementing automated power management for office equipment, and optimizing the use of natural light to reduce electricity consumption. Energy reductions were calculated using GHG Protocol guidelines and ISO 14001 Environmental Management System (EMS) standards in the Hong Kong office. To ensure accuracy, data was verified through regular internal audits and carbon assessments, ensuring a reliable assessment of energy efficiency improvements.

Section Name: 302-5 Reduction in energy requirements of products and services
Guidance:
a. Reductions in energy requirements of sold products and services achieved during the reporting period, in joules or multiples.
b. Basis for calculating reductions in energy consumption, such as base year or baseline, including the rationale for choosing it.
c. Standards, methodologies, assumptions, and/or calculation tools used.
Sample: During the reporting period, ABC Systems Holdings Ltd. achieved an absolute reduction of 126 GJ in the energy requirements of its software solutions and IT services, compared to the previous year. This reduction, measured against a FY2018 baseline, was primarily driven by server optimization in cloud-based services, enhancements in software efficiency, and reductions in power consumption of IT infrastructure. The energy savings were assessed by comparing pre- and post-implementation consumption levels using GHG Protocol guidelines for consistency and accuracy. To ensure reliability, the calculations assumed uniform implementation of energy-saving measures across all regions, with adjustments made for differences in product deployment and service usage patterns. Data was verified through internal audits and energy assessments, ensuring the reported reductions accurately reflect efficiency improvements.

Guidance:
a. A description of how the organization interacts with water, including how and where water is withdrawn, consumed, and discharged, and the water-related impacts the organization has caused or contributed to, or that are directly linked to its operations, products, or services by its business relationships (e.g., impacts caused by runoff).
b. A description of the approach used to identify water-related impacts, including the scope of assessments, their timeframe, and any tools or methodologies used.
c. A description of how water-related impacts are addressed, including how the organization works with stakeholders to steward water as a shared resource, and how it engages with suppliers or customers with significant water-related impacts.
d. An explanation of the process for setting any water-related goals and targets that are part of the organization’s approach to managing water and effluents, and how they relate to public policy and the local context of each area with water stress.
Sample: ABC Systems Holdings Ltd. sources water from local municipal supplies at its operational sites in Hong Kong, the Philippines, and the United Kingdom, primarily for sanitation, cooling systems, and general office use. In FY2019, total water consumption was 218 cubic meters, representing a 34% reduction from 331 cubic meters in FY2018. This data is metered, collected through water flow meters and utility bills, and verified via internal audits to ensure accuracy. All water used is discharged into municipal wastewater systems and treated in compliance with local environmental regulations. To mitigate water-related impacts, ABC has set a target to reduce water consumption by 10% by FY2022, focusing on installing water-efficient fixtures, enhancing leakage detection systems, and promoting conservation practices among employees. The company conducts annual assessments aligned with ISO 14001 standards, using consumption tracking software and engaging with local water authorities to monitor regional water stress levels and ensure regulatory compliance.
